page.title: 07Religion
page.content: In Newton-on-Ouse,a Methodist Chapel built in 1924,in the York North Circuit serves Newton & Linton.The Minister acts as Free Church Minister at R A.F.Linton-on-Ouse. The Parish Church,All Saints,in the Diocese of York,was built in 1849 at the expense of Payan and Lydia Dawnay of Beningbrough Hall.The architect was George Townsend Andrews.The tall, limestone spire is built on top of an older tower,the only remaining part of a church built 900 years ago.The Church serves Linton,Newton and Beningbrough.A C.of E.church on the R.A.F.Station has a visiting padre. St.Pius X is a Roman Catholic Church on the R.A.F.Station for Air Force personnel and civilians. An Anglican Church in Nun Monkton serves the people of Widdington.
